Package no.ntnu.idatg2001.paths.model

Class Story

java.lang.Object
no.ntnu.idatg2001.paths.model.Story
@Entity public class Story extends Object
The Story class is a container for the story. It contains the title of the story, a map of all the passages in the story, and the opening passage.
Version:
2023.05.20
Author:
Erik Bjørnsen and Emil Klevgård-Slåttsveen

    This function creates a new story with a title.

    This function creates a new story with a title and an opening passage.

  • Constructor Details

    • Story

      public Story(String title, Passage openingPassage)
      This function creates a new story with a title and an opening passage.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the story.
      openingPassage - The opening passage of the story.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the title is null, blank or empty.

      public Passage getOpeningPassage()
      This function returns the opening passage of the game.
      Returns:
      The opening passage of the game.

    • setOpeningPassage

      public void setOpeningPassage(Passage openingPassage)
      This function sets the opening passage of the game. If the opening passage is already set, it will be removed from the passages map.
      Parameters:
      openingPassage - The opening passage of the game.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the opening passage is null.

    • addPassage

      public void addPassage(Passage passage)
      This function adds a passage to the story.
      Parameters:
      passage - The passage that gets added to the game.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the passage is null or already exists.

    • getPassages

      public List<Passage> getPassages()
      This function returns a list of all the passages in the story.

      This function returns a list of all the passages except for the opening passage.

      A list of all the passages except for the opening passage.

    • reverseLink

      public Link reverseLink(Link link)
      This function returns the "proxy" link of a another link.
      Parameters:
      link - The link that you want to get the proxy link of.
      Returns:
      The proxy link of the given link.

    • getAllPassagesThatDoesNotHaveALinkPointingToThem

      public List<Passage> getAllPassagesThatDoesNotHaveALinkPointingToThem()

      Returns:
      A list of all the passages that does not have a link pointing to them.

    • getLinkedPassage

      public Passage getLinkedPassage(Link link)
      Returns the passage that is linked to the given link.
      Parameters:
      link - The link that is connected to the passage that gets returned.
      Returns:
      The passage that is linked to the given link.

    • removePassage

      public void removePassage(Link link)
      This function removes a passage from the story.
      Parameters:
      link - The link that is connected to the passage that gets removed.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the link is null or if the link does not exist in the story.

    • getBrokenLinks

      public List<Link> getBrokenLinks()
      This function returns a list of all the links that are broken. A broken link is a link that points to a passage that does not exist.
      Returns:
      A list of all the links that are broken.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the story. Returns the title of the story.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      The title of the story.

    • getId

      public Long getId()
      This function returns the id of the story. This is used by the database.
      Returns:
      The id of the story.

    • shortestPathFromOpeningPassage

      public int shortestPathFromOpeningPassage(Passage to)
      This function returns the minimum number of passages needed to traverse from the opening passage to a given passage.
      Parameters:
      to - The passage to go to.
      Returns:
      The minimum number of passages.
